page.title: 01RUGELEY, STAFFORDSHIRE
page.content: Rugeley is situated in the Trent Valley between Stafford and Lichfield. The town dates back to Saxon times and was called "Ridge Leah" then later "Ridgeley". Rugeley lies on the rising ground between the river and Cannock Chase (some 70 square miles of forest and heath) to the south. To the north the flat valley is mainly covered by mixed farm land. Rugeley was a small market town with local industries. The main occupations in 1985 are in the coal mine, the power stations, electronics and in shops and commerce. New housing estates have been built since 1950 for people working in these industries. Rugeley is separated from the West Midlands conurbation by Cannock Chase and is 8 miles from the nearest towns of Stafford, Lichfield and Cannock. The population in 1985 was about 30,000.
